This consists of leftovers from dumpsters, bits of meat left on bones in the wilderness, or poorly foraged greens. | | Field Ration | Heal 5 | 5g | 5 | Grains, Protein | Bread or rice combined with beans or dried meats. | | Huge Chop | Heal 20 | 40g | 10 | Large Meat | A large chunk of red meat that has been smoked or roasted and thoroughly seasoned. | | Ginger Ale | Heal 10,Cure Sickened | 40g | 5 | Sugar, Roots | Brewed roots with sugar. | | Melted Cheese | Heal 20 | 80g | 5 | Milk, Fungus | A fancy cheese that has gone through extensive processing. | | Fancy Cake | Heal 30 | 80g | 10 | Egg, Sugar, Milk | The classic baker's treat. Takes 45 minutes to eat. | | Mega Malon Meal | Heal 80 | 640g | 10 | Grains, Large Meat, Cheese, Roots, Oil, Sugar | A master chef's go-to meal of choice: An extremely greasy burger with a side of fries and a sugary drink. |

entries.title: Ingredients
entries.content: Ingredients are used to create Food items, for those that want to get the most out of the Cooking skill. They are usually acquired from Foraging or as Loot. Some Ingredients are also Food - mainly ones that restore HP. Ingredients are categorized into ten basic groups, and a Food item must be made with ingredients from different groups. There are 10 basic Ingredient groups from which most other Food is derived. | Ingredient | Description | | ---------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Egg | A shelled or membranous object containing a creature's embryo and a yolk. | | Fungus | Mushrooms, molds, yeasts, and other non-plant organisms that grow on organic matter. | | Grain | Seeds or similar vegetable matter, particularly ones that can be turned into Flour. | | Large Meat | Large portions of muscle tissue taken from a large animal. Smaller animals, such as mundane rodents, only qualify as Protein. | | Milk | Any liquid produced by a creature to feed its young, particularly from mammals. | | Oil | Hydrophobic liquids pressed from energy-dense organic matter, such as seeds or fat. | | Protein | Any small meats or legumes that can be used to supplement dietary needs for muscle growth. | | Roots | Hard and typically woody energy-dense organic matter taken from the roots of plants, such as tubers. | | Sugar | Fruits, honey, and other sweet items. | | Vegetable | Edible plant matter that does not fall into the Grain or Roots categories, typically leafy greens or stalks. | If a creature does not specify that it drops any Ingredients, it can still be harvested using Butcher to acquire some if it is organic. Ingredients almost always make up a majority of a Food's value. Players should provide this value with roughly equal amounts of each Ingredient group. However, some leeway should be given to not overly restrict the cooking process and slow down gameplay.

entries.title: Enchanting
entries.content: Enchanting is the process of adding magic to items via Crafting. Enchanting can only be done on items with Upgrade Slots.

entries.title: Scroll for Weapon Accuracy
entries.content: Infusion Scroll 10,000g Can be applied to any Weapon. Roll d2-1. The weapon gains this much ACC.
entries.path: Equipment/Magic Items/Infusion Scrolls/Weapon Infusion Scrolls/Scroll for Weapon Accuracy.md

entries.title: Infusion Scroll
entries.content: An Infusion Scroll can be used on an item's Upgrade Slot to apply a numeric bonus to its statistics, or add additional effects. They are a cheaper, but often more random alternative to upgrading via Enchanting. A given Infusion Scroll will specify what items it can be used on. Many infusion scrolls provide random bonuses.

entries.title: Upgrade Slot
entries.content: Upgrade Slots are the potential for items to become more powerful through magic upgrades, such as through an Infusion Scroll or Enchanting. Weapons, Armor, and Magic Items can all have Upgrade Slots. The consumption of an Upgrade Slot cannot be undone.

entries.title: Mundane Item
entries.content: Mundane Items can usually be bought in many locations around the world with the correct vendor in town. Many have real life analogues.

entries.title: Property
entries.content: Mundane Item. Property is synonymous with land, and everything on it. Property can include facilities, homes, or resources of interest. The price of property changes based on a few factors, such as size, buildings, appearance, location, and the overall state its in, to name a few.

entries.title: Tools
entries.content: 80g Mundane Item Tools typically come in sets catered to a specific task, such as fishing or medicine. Some tasks require the use of tools, others only give a penalty if you don't have tools. Tools also come in a masterwork variety, giving the user a +4 bonus on the skill in question. The price is increased to 800g. Some tasks do not have associated tools, and therefore are not suitable for acquiring masterwork variants to them. Skills like medicine, alchemy and profession use tools. Skills like stealth, perception and persuasion do not. Some types of tools might be able to aid you with novel types of tasks, such as using a spyglass to roll perception long distances, but should not give any types of persistent flat bonuses. Most tool kits weigh 10 lbs. Some tasks, such as smithing, require even more advanced tools you can't carry around, such as a forge.

entries.title: Torch
entries.content: 10g Mundane Item Torches are sticks wrapped with some type of cloth, chemical or vegetable matter that is flammable. Torches give off bright light in a 20 ft radius around them, and dim light 20 ft past that. They can stay lit for up to 2 hours. Lighting and dimming a torch repeatedly can significantly decrease the amount of time they stay lit. If a torch ends up getting wet, it becomes unusable.

entries.title: Adamant Armor
entries.content: Heavy Armor Armor made from Adamant is at the limits of what civilization is capable of creating without extensive use of magic. It is only given only to the champions of a nation, the armor of a chosen one, a creation that makes the wearer seemingly invincible. | | | | ----------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | AC | | | Special Qualitie Resistance to Slash, Pierce, Crush, FireDR 2Technique: Unbreakable Body e: | | Upgrade Slots | | Crafting | | | ------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | Item Value | 30,000,000g | | Mana Crystal | 100,000 | | Resources | Adamant MetalLeather from a Fire-Aligned Creature of at least Lv 8Volcanic Forge worth at least 2,000,000g | | Craft DC | 40 |

entries.content: Heavy Armor This polished armor is a symbol of status for warriors and paladins. It stands at the height of protection that steel can provide, making battles against the mundane a trivial pursuit. | | | | ----------------- | ------------------------------- | | AC | 6 | | Special Qualities | Resistance to Slash | | Upgrade Slots | 2 | | Crafting | | | ------------ | -------------- | | Item Value | 35000g | | Mana Crystal | 60 | | Resources | Metal, Leather |

entries.content: 2-Handed Axe A heavy curved axe optimized for swinging in great arcs. Developed by Orcs to quickly dispatch smaller creatures in large groups, allowing for low swings to land with good edge alignment. | Statistics | | | ------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------- | | AS | 2 | | Damage | 2d8 | | Damage Type | S | | Weapon Qualities | +1 ACCTechnique: Great Cleave | | Upgrade Slots | 1 | | Crafting | | | ------------ | ----- | | Item Value | 2000g | | Mana Crystal | 1 | | Resources | Metal |

entries.title: Ammunition
entries.content: Ammunition is a subtype Weapon Group. All Ammunition is either also part of another Weapon Group, or does not function as a weapon on its own. These represent arrows, bolts, rocks, bullets, darts, or any other weapon that is either part of another weapon's use, or that is meant to be launched by itself in quick succession. ~={orange}Ammunition can be drawn as an Instant Action. Ammunition and its price and weight represent an unlimited source. You cannot easily "share" or otherwise split Ammunition between allies. You either have the ammunition or you don't - Exceptions can be made in the heat of combat, such as firing back an arrow that just hit a tree next to you. | Name | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------ | | Arrows | - | P | Used with bows. | | Bolts | - | P | Used with crossbows. |
entries.path: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Subtypes/Ammunition.md

entries.title: Natural Weapon
entries.content: Natural Weapons are a subtype Weapon Group. All Natural Weapons are also part of another Weapon Group. These weapons are part of a creature's being. Examples include claws, fists, tails, horns, stingers, and tentacles. Most natural weapons are not universal, meaning they are different for each creature that has them and will be noted as such in their stat block. However, they do follow common trends.
entries.path: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Subtypes/Natural Weapon.md

entries.title: Staff
entries.content: A staff is a subtype Weapon Group. This is also a label used for anything that can complete the Staff (S) component of spells.

entries.title: Blade
entries.content: Blades are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed. These weapons are meant for slicing and stabbing, relying on the blade to do the cutting with a mere touch rather than chopping or committed thrusts. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Blade group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | -------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------ | | Sword | 3 | d10 | P/S | | | 2H Sword | 2 | 2d8 | S | 2H |

entries.title: Bludgeon
entries.content: Bludgeons are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed. These weapons are meant to beat the snot out of enemies in the most primitive way possible. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Bludgeon group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | -------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------ | | Club | 3 | d10 | C | | | 2H Club | 2 | 2d8 | C | 2H |

entries.title: Bow
entries.content: Bows are a group of Weapons that are 2-handed. These are curved weapons held at the ends by taut or resistant elastic strings used for firing Ammunition with a drawing motion. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Bow group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | -------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------------ | | Shortbow | 2 | 2d6 | P | 2H, Long RangeUses "Arrow" Ammunition. |

entries.title: Close
entries.content: Close Weapons are a group of Weapons that are "1-handed". These represent punches, kicks, claws, and headbutts that can be used in the closest of combat, even when pinned. These attacks can be with one's own Natural Weapons, or with weapons augmenting their limbs. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Close group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | ------------ | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Unarmed | 3 | 1 | C | Punches, kicks, headbutts, and any other strikes with one's own body.Natural WeaponFreehanded By default, if you use Unarmed Strikes for Dual Wielding and you do not have a free hand, the AS is reduced by 2. | | Knuckler | 4 | d6 | C | | | Spiked Armor | 1 | d6 | P | Freehanded |

entries.title: Dagger
entries.content: Daggers are a group of Weapons that are 1-handed. These are short, sharp weapons for getting close to enemies and striking weak spots or overwhelming them with angles of attack. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Dagger group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | ------ | -------------- | ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Dagger | 42(thrown) | d6d6 | P/SP | Also a Thrown weapon. Thrown range (Pierce only, AS 2) Hands +2 |
entries.path: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Dagger.md

entries.title: Polearm
entries.content: Polearms are a group of Weapons that are 2-handed. These are long skirmish weapons for battlefield versatility. They combine the spacing of spears with the swings of axes. Often used to hook enemies in addition to being general weapons. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Polearm group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | -------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------ | | Staff | 3 | d8 | C | Staff | | Polearm | 2 | 2d6 | P/S | 2H Reach Fell +2 | | 2H Staff | 2 | 2d6 | C | 2HStaff |
entries.path: Equipment/Weapon Rules/Weapon Types and Basic Weapons/Polearm.md

entries.title: Thrown
entries.content: Thrown weapons are a group of Weapons that are almost always 1-handed. These are weapons designed to be thrown using a swing from the hand or sling. Casters are armored gauntlets with thrown ammunition stored inside, used to draw and throw faster and harder. Many Thrown weapons are also Ammunition. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Thrown group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | ------ | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Rock | 2 | d6 | C | AmmunitionThrown Range You can readily pick up rocks whenever they exist in the environment and you have a free hand. You do not need to have rocks in your inventory unless there are none nearby. Not compatible with Casters. | | Dart | 2 | d6 | P | AmmunitionThrown Range | | Caster | +1 | - | - | Attached to the arm/hand. This hand can hold, but not use, other items; the caster cannot be used while you're holding something with that hand. AC +1 AS +1 with the chosen Ammunition Ammunition is stored inside. The two items become one. Adding, removing, or replacing the ammunition is a Full-Round Action. |

entries.title: Thrust
entries.content: Thrust weapons are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed. These are blades and spears meant for dedicated thrusts to put enormous pressure at a single point. Often used to outrange and lunge at opponents. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Thrust group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | -------- | -------------- | ---------- | ----------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Spear | 32(Ranged) | d10d10 | PP | Also a Thrown weapon.Thrown Range (AS 2) | | 2H Spear | 2 | 2d8 | P | 2H | | Lance | 2 | 2d8 | P | 2h Reach Must be mounted, or else it gets -1 AS. Only requires one hand while mounted, but still counts as 2-handed for beneficial purposes. |

entries.title: Trigger
entries.content: Trigger weapons are a group of Weapons that can be 1-handed or 2-handed. These are weapons with handles that are loaded beforehand and then fire their ammunition with a trigger. Trigger weapons do not add STR to damage. The following are the Basic Weapons in the Trigger group. | Name | AS | Damage | Damage Type | Description and Weapon Qualities | | -------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------- | -------------------------------------------- | | Crossbow | 1 | 2d8 | P | 2H, Long RangeUses Ammunition (Bolt) | | Pistol | 1 | 2d6 | P | Short RangeUses Ammunition (Bullet) |
