If a creature within 1 mile of you uses that word, phrase, or name to refer to you, you immediately learn that creature’s name, appearance, and location. This ends the spell.

entries.title: Confide
entries.content: Tier 2 Enthrallment Spell Instant Action, Limited Psychic, Subtle Divination | Effect | | | ----------- | --------------------- | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Creature | | Save | - | | Duration | Permanent, 10 Minutes | Whenever you share information with a creature that it promises not to share (or a similar conditional offer of information and promised subtlety), you may cast this spell on them, which delays its effect until they break their promise. If the target breaks their secrecy, the spell activates, and you can see through their eyes and senses for up to 10 minutes, after which the spell ends for good. At any point during those 10 minutes, you may end the spell prematurely to inflict 40 Psychic Damage on the target. This damage cannot kill the creature outright, but if it is Defeated by this damage, it gains the Placeholder Affliction. This spell does not stack. If multiple creatures use Confide on the same creature, it may only be affected by the damage once per day. Upcast 1 - +20 Damage.

For the duration of the spell, the creature acts as though it has no equipment, and cannot use anything dependent on equipment, such as shield actions, spell casting, and weapon special attacks. At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save to end the effect. They still get any passive bonuses to their equipment, such as AC from Armor and Shields. When used on an ally, this spell lasts for one hour, but they are still able to use their equipment. Equipment in their hands is not affected.

Whenever you glean something using Insight, you can transfer the knowledge you gain to any creature you can see as vague impressions, effectively treating it as though they had succeeded in using Detect Dishonesty.

Whenever they initiate an Attack or opposed Skill check and miss or fail, they take SP+CL Psychic Damage. They get a new save every time they take this damage.

entries.content: Tier 2 Enthrallment Spell Standard Action, Limited Buff, Glamer Illusion | Effect | | | ----------- | ------------------------- | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Creature of Your Size | | Save | Will | | Duration | 1 Hour | You instantly Disguise the target creature, causing them to appear identical to you. While standing adjacent to a creature that looks identical to you, Attacks and Targeted Abilities roll to randomly target among all adjacent identical creatures. Offending creatures get a Will save per attempt, and upon passing, they are immune to that instance of the spell. Upcast 1 - Target one additional creature.

In order to speak at all, the creature must spend a Swift Action instead of a Free Action (For example, sharing information after using Monster Lore). In order to cast a spell that normally requires a Swift Action, the creature must spend a Standard Action. In order to cast a spell that normally requires a Standard Action, the creature must spend a Full-Round Action. This increase in action cost can reasonably apply to any other actions based on speech as well.

The target will speak its opinions on the subject matter and its conversation partner(s) in great detail as they come to mind.

entries.title: Dominate
entries.content: Tier 3 Enthrallment Spell Action-Attack, Recharge Mind-Affecting, Charm, Concentration Illusion | Effect | | | ----------- | ---------- | | Range | 30 | | Target/Area | 1 Creature | | Save | Will | | Duration | 1 Minute | You link your mind with a creature and enforce your will upon it. The creature must save or be Charmed for the duration of the spell, and you can telepathically give orders to the dominated creature. They must follow these orders unless they are very obviously self-harming. For all intents and purposes, this creature is considered your ally as long as they are dominated. If you know of the creature's abilities, you can command it to use them, otherwise they use their normal tactics in your aid. At the end of each turn, the creature gets a new save against the effect. The spell ends if any of your allies harm the target (including you).

entries.title: Ecstasy

The creature is Dazed for 1 round and Staggered the round after (Will reduces to Staggered for 1 round). If the target creature could reasonably be sexually attracted to the caster, then the DC is increased by 1. If the caster is naked, or barely clothed, the DC is increased by an additional 1. Upcast 1 - Target one additional creature.

entries.title: Order 66

After completing the cast time, you cause the target to forget you casted this spell. At any point thereafter, you can trigger the true effects of this spell by speaking a passphrase in a manner where the target can clearly hear you as a Standard Action. For 1 minute, the creature aids you in combat, attacking your enemies as you direct them. Once this effect is triggered, the contingency ends. The contingent aspect of this spell applies to the caster, not the target creature. The spell leaves behind subtle cues, allowing those Trained in Insight to realize the creature is affected by this spell (Spell DC+4). Creatures only ever get 1 check to realize this enchantment is in place.

The target Companion is Taunted by its leader for 1 round (Will negates). This ability cleanses all other taunt effects currently affecting the companion creature if the spell is successful. Upcast 2 - You can target an additional Companion.

entries.title: Seduce
entries.content: Tier 4 Enthrallment Spell Action-Attack, Limited Mind-Affecting, Concentration Illusion | Effect | | | ----------- | ------------ | | Range | 30 | | Target/Area | 10 Ft Radius | | Save | Will | | Duration | 3 Rounds | Creatures in the area that fail their save must spend all of their Movement every turn getting closer to you, or to a creature of your choosing.

entries.content: Tier 5 Enthrallment Spell Standard Action, Limited Mind-Affecting, Charm, Companion Illusion | Effect | | | ----------- | -------------------------------- | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Willing or Helpless Creature | | Save | Will | | Duration | Permanent | Functions as Dominate, but is permanent. The affected creature becomes a Companion and does not get new saves on its own. If a friend, ally, respected superior, family member, or similar person of significance uses Aid on the creature, it gets a new Will save at -5. If at least three creatures spend their turn doing this at once, there is no penalty. Certain types of people, such as people related to the controlled creature's destiny or true love, can give them +5 on their save. Successful Dispel attempts grant a new save.

entries.title: Enthrallment
entries.content: Enthrallment spells focus on deceit, as well as mental domination of both overt and subtle varieties. Most of this spell list was created by studying the abilities of Shira, a fiend lord Kitsune who stole Free Will from the world for her personal amusement. She is a master of subterfuge, and often exists among mortals, playing along with their politics and wars for fun. Being the least abrasive and the most approachable, Shira is the fiend lord the most mortals find intertwined in their life, often not knowing that they deal with a fiend. Over an enormous period of time, new fields of natural magic formed to fill in the void left by Free Will, such as a Vampire's ability to make thralls. Part of the spell list is sourced from the natural abilities of such creatures.

entries.title: Astrology
entries.content: Tier 1 Lunar Spell 10 Minute Cast Time, At-Will M - Scroll or Parchment Divination | Effect | | | ----------- | ------------ | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Creature | | Save | - | | Duration | - | When the spell is complete, you convert a scroll or parchment into a Horoscope. The target can read the Horoscope to gain insight into some of the strengths and failings they may have within the next 24 hours. As long as they have the horoscope on their person, they may add 2 to their Roll on a skill check. This cannot be used with Take 10 or Take 30. After they use this benefit, the horoscope disappears. A creature that cannot read cannot benefit from their Horoscope. A creature may only benefit from Astrology once per day.

entries.title: Enchant Sapphire
entries.content: Tier 1 Lunar Spell 1 Hour Cast Time, At-Will M - Sapphire Jewelry or a Sapphire, worth at least 500g Divination, Transmutation | Effect | | | ----------- | --------------------------------- | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Sapphire, or Sapphire Jewelry | | Save | - | | Duration | - | You cast a spell on a Sapphire jewel or jewelry, turning it into a consumable magic item. The effects vary based on where the item goes on the body. Jewelry pieces take up Equipment Slots. | | | | ----------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Ring(Accessory) | You create a Ring of Recoil, which reflects 1 Magic Damage on every instance of damage to the creature that inflicted it, if any. Once it has reflected 40 damage, the ring disintegrates. | | Necklace(Accessory) | You create a Necklace of Breathing, which automatically activates when you run out of breath, such as underwater or in outer space. As long as your airways are not obstructed, you can continue to breathe. Once activated, it lasts for 20 minutes, and then disintegrates. | | Bracelet(Accessory) | You create a Bracelet of Artisanship, which reduces the Labor cost of something you're Crafting by 500 (maximum half of its original Labor cost). You must keep the item equipped until it is complete. When you finish, the bracelet disintegrates. | | Tiara(Headgear) | You create a Tiara of Clarity, which allows you to Re-Roll a failed Will save against a Mind-Affecting effect. If you pass the Re-Roll, the tiara disintegrates. | | Jewel | You create a Distress Crystal, which sends a distress signal to up to 5 total friends and family members of your choice when you are Defeated, Dead, or fear for your life. They receive a brief telepathic message in your voice that describes your location to the best of your knowledge, and to please send help. They cannot respond to this message, and after the message is sent, the jewel disintegrates. |

entries.title: Natural Geomancy
entries.content: Tier 1 Lunar Spell 10 Minute Cast Time, At-Will Divination | Effect | | | ----------- | ----------------------------------- | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Plant or 5 Ft Radius of Terrain | | Save | - | | Duration | 2 days | For the duration of this spell, you get a mental ping whenever anything happens to the targeted plant or plot of terrain. You are informed what kind of interaction happened, such as whether it was trampled, touched, clipped, watered, etc. no matter how insignificant the interaction. You're also aware of the environmental conditions they are experiencing, such as approximate temperature, humidity, and even noise level. For plants, you gain a +2 bonus to Nature checks to determine their health and needs, and can identify such mentally and remotely. This spell does not grant visual stimuli.

entries.title: Provider's Station
entries.content: Tier 1 Lunar Spell 10 Minute Cast Time, Limited Conjuration | Effect | | | ----------- | ----- | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | - | | Save | - | | Duration | 1 Day | You must have access to the night sky to cast this spell. When the spell is complete, you create an object or small facility that meets the bare minimum requirements for a particular task, trade, or skill, such as a furnace for heating pottery or a lockpick. This item will break if used for anything other than its intended purpose, and disappears after the spell's duration or if exposed to sunlight. You must create facilities that can fit within a 10ft cube. This spell does not provide fuel to run facilities. It may create objects with multiple parts, such as a series of vials and tubes for use in alchemy, but these cannot be separated from the facility without disappearing.

entries.title: Star Sight
entries.content: Tier 1 Lunar Spell Standard Action, At-Will Divination | Effect | | | ----------- | --------- | | Range | - | | Target/Area | Self | | Save | - | | Duration | One Round | You gain a completely unobstructed view of the sky as though it was a clear night. You ignore obtrusive environmental conditions, being indoors and underground, light pollution, and anything similar. You get a +2 bonus to Navigate.

entries.title: Lunar Dream
entries.content: Tier 2 Lunar Spell Standard Action, Limited Transmutation | Effect | | | ----------- | ---------- | | Range | - | | Target/Area | Self | | Save | - | | Duration | 30 Minutes | This spell must be cast in the presence of moonlight. You fall asleep, your body lifted into the air on a cloud of stardust. Every minute, you regain 1 HP. After 30 minutes, you are restored to full HP. You also gain a new save vs any Poison and non-Curse spell effects. This counts as a Short Rest, but you cannot eat to gain the benefits of Food. You are otherwise asleep as normal, and anything that would normally wake you up still can. This ends the spell early, denying its full effect.

entries.title: Unseen Blade
entries.content: Tier 2 Lunar Spell Swift Action, At-Will Subtle Illusion | Effect | | | ----------- | ------------ | | Range | Reach | | Target/Area | One Creature | | Save | - | | Duration | - | When making any Attack while the target is in the presence of moonlight, you can turn your weapon or projectile partially invisible to Feint the target right before the attack is made.

entries.title: Lunar
entries.content: Surrounding the magic of the moon are many Lunar Realms, ruled over by a single Lunar Kingdom. The magic of the realms themselves bestowed the royalty of the ruling class, with the Queen and King at the top being given unique wisdom and strength with which to lead their people. The secrets to their magic were closely guarded by the royal family until the last King was murdered in a foreign adversary's coup attempt, and the princess at the time mysteriously disappeared for months. When she returned to take the throne back, she made the secrets of the Moon Queen's Wisdom public knowledge, but the secrets to the Moon King's Strength was forever lost when the Moon Princess died without providing the Lunar Realms a new heir. These spells are based upon the Moon Queen's Wisdom. They focus on abilities passed down from the stars themselves that grant foresight, prosperity, retribution, and access to the ebb and flow of magic from heavenly bodies. Many offensive Lunar spells have delayed or indirect effects. Some Lunar spells require access to the night sky.

entries.title: Prismancy
entries.content: Prismancy sorceries are spells that focus on heat and light to inflict maximum damage as quickly as possible. Each spell channels the power of intense light, unleashing explosive projectiles, blinding flashes, and radiant energy capable of turning the world into a prismatic inferno. This spell list was developed by Tiara Torneau, an Evocation Archmage renowned for her mastery over flames and light. Using her inherited powers over light, this hobby magic turned into a field of study that brought fire magic to the next level, incorporating auroras and the power of the sun to devastating results. Her goal of ending fights with overwhelming power were shared with the pyromancers of the time, resulting in a modern list that will tickle any blaster-caster's fancy of annihilation and enormous, flashy explosions, while maintaining the utility necessary for an adventuring sort.

When you cast the spell, you telepathically communicate simple ideas that require no more than two sentences to convey (Monsters are attacking the north gate. How do we respond?). Your target can reply with the same restrictions. If your message is too complex or too long, the creature is dead, or the creature is on another plane, then the message gets lost in the ether and the caster takes 1 Psychic Damage. entries.title: Psychomancy
entries.content: Psychomancy involves the use of mind magic to gather information and out maneuver foes before the battles even begin. If it does come down to a fight, you can crush foes' minds or toss them around with Telekinesis. Long distance communication is made easy with spells like Dream and Sending. Creatures won't be able to keep secrets from you with access to spells like Detect Thoughts and Memory Movie.

entries.title: Vitalism
entries.content: Vitalism spells are a supporting caster's best toolkit. They are tailored towards protecting the sanctity of life, and reaching and increasing the strength of allies. These spells are typically Holy-aligned, and any offensive abilities are typically tailored towards disrupting Fiends and Undead.

entries.title: CL
entries.content: Caster Level Spells often include Caster Level as part of their total damage, or they may use it in calculating opposed checks, such as when dispelling. Martial Techniques can also use Caster Level as part of their damage, but it is much less common. By default, your CL is equal to your LV, and your spell's CL is equal to yours plus any bonuses you have to it, such as from Staves and Feats. Usually, the term refers to the effect's CL itself, not the user's personal CL. Usually, a creature's personal CL does not deviate from their level much, if at all. Therefore, assume any use of CL does not refer to personal CL unless otherwise noted.

entries.title: M
entries.content: Material Component Any spell with a Material Component has an item with a price associated with that is consumed on use. Anything with a Focus component has an item with a price associated that is NOT consumed on use. You do not need to have these items in your hand - they merely need to be on your person to be used. They may briefly appear in the visuals of the spell or otherwise float out of your inventory as necessary.

entries.title: S
entries.content: Staff Component All spells have a Staff (S) Component. Disarming a mage of their staff prevents them from casting using it, and ends any spell they're concentrating on with it. "Staff" components do not need to be exclusively provided by staves. Many other items, such as wands and seals, can also be used to serve the Staff component. - Staff - Staves are usually long and sturdy pieces of wood. Most of the magical components of the staff are attached to the end of it. Staves can universally be used as weapons, and may augment specific kinds of spells. - Seal - Seals have an enormous amount of variety to them. They are typically compact: Some small handheld object, often of spiritual significance. Seals are ineffective unless they are the only thing occupying the hand. Seals often alter the use of spells. - Wand - Wands are usually small pieces of wood about in the rough shape of a pencil, but usually a bit larger. Wands are lightweight and easy to bring many of, and may grant additional spells prepared. - Tome - Tomes, grimoires, or otherwise magical books can often serve as Staff components. They can be used to prepare spells you do not know, and must be in hand when used to cast said spells.

entries.title: Spell Components
entries.content: Spells have components that must be used to cast them. This almost always includes Staff (S) and Verbal (V) Components, and sometimes include Material (M) Components. These rules do not apply to Innate Casting.

entries.title: Spell
entries.content: Spellcasting is a general title that applies to a specific type of magical effect, with specific rules. Spells do not encompass all magic, but it is the most common type. Most Spells are Techniques. All spells have some kind of visual effect associated with their casting before the effect occurs. Magic circles shining fingers and eyes, words manifesting into physical objects and circling the caster are all means to easily identify when a creature is casting a spell. The only exception to this is spells with the Subtle tag. This is also the case for Innate Casting. Spellcasting takes into account your Caster Level and Spell Power, and requires using Somatic, Material, and Verbal Components (Innate Casting does not require components).

entries.title: Untitled
entries.content: SP

entries.title: V
entries.content: Verbal Component All spells have a verbal component. Verbal components cannot be whispered, and you must speak them clearly. Anything that prevents the mage from speaking prevents them from casting, such as being silenced. The verbal components often contain a plain-language reading of the spell's structure or its name, in a Language known by the caster. When observing a caster using a language you understand, you need only have Arcana to identify it.

entries.title: Weather and Terrain vs Spells
entries.content: Certain high level spells manipulate the weather or terrain in drastic ways. If multiple casters attempt to cast different spells that affect the same weather, the higher CL always wins. In the event where the caster tries to interfere with weather that is supernaturally powerful (created by natural magic, associated with cursed terrain, etc.), the DM should assign the effect an effective CL. All weather-inducing spells do not function underground. With smaller-scale terrain changes or unforeseen interactions between spells and an environment, an opposed CL check is more appropriate.

entries.title: Innate Technique
entries.content: Some Techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as when gained from Race, Class, magic item, specialized training, or a boon granted by another creature. Not all Techniques gained in this way are innate - these are much more common on monsters. Innate Techniques acquired by players do not take up Mana slots and are always prepared. Monsters usually have their natural abilities represented by Innate Techniques, and as such are usually made with an amount equal to their Mana. Innate Techniques grant creatures the ability to use Techniques without the usual requirements. Spells do not require the Staff component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting. Concentration spells can still be ended with a Disarm Combat Maneuver. Only one Concentration effect can be upkept in this way. Unless otherwise specified, you cannot re-prepare limited innate techniques to regain their use. If a creature's innate constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a Swift Action.

entries.title: Preparing Techniques
entries.content: When you have technique points invested in a specific style, you can prepare any of the techniques of the tier you have unlocked. Mana slots determine how many techniques you can have prepared or "memorized" at any given time and thus what you can use at a given moment. All techniques are assumed to take 1 mana slot unless stated otherwise. Abilities from items, classes, etc. do not take mana slots unless stated otherwise - see Innate Technique.

entries.title: Technique
entries.content: A Technique is the form most abilities take. They are one of the major means of combat progression in the game. Techniques are often things that you use in combat, but many have out-of-combat uses as well. Spells may contain a greater portion of out-of-combat effects. Techniques are either martial or magic, in the form of Spells. By default, non-Spell Techniques are Martial. In general, classes get access to a few technique trees. They gain technique points at odd levels, or may automatically get a specific tree at those odd levels. Techniques are separated into five levels, requiring 6 points of investment in order to reach the highest tier. Every even level, you get a technique point you can invest into any technique path, separate from what you get from your class. For every point you invest, you get access to a new level of technique. Technique levels have a hard character LV requirement when investing points to unlock more. At level 1, you can unlock the first tier, but every tier thereafter is available at every odd level, maxing out at tier 6 at level 11.

entries.title: Upcast
entries.content: Many abilities, particularly Techniques, become stronger or gain additional functions as you gain levels. This is formatted as "Upcast X," where X is how many technique levels higher it becomes. Upcasting stacks (when applicable), allowing you to gain the bonuses repeatedly at regular intervals. You do not need to have unlocked the higher technique levels in a given path to upcast a technique. You merely need to meet the level requirement for techniques of that level. Improvements to your CL can allow access to Upcast bonuses early.

entries.title: Icon Usage Guide
entries.content: Icon Usage Guide for Content Writers This guide shows you how to add beautiful icons to your markdown notes - both in the navigation sidebar and inside your content! 🎯 Quick Start: Adding Icons to Note Titles Want an icon to appear next to your note in the sidebar? It's easy! Step 1: Add Icon to Your Note's Frontmatter At the very top of your file, add a special section called "frontmatter" with an line: The lines are important - they tell the system where the frontmatter starts and ends. Step 2: Save and Commit After you save your file: 1. Commit and push your changes to GitHub 2. The system automatically updates (GitHub Actions does this for you!) 3. Wait a minute for the deployment, then refresh your browser Step 3: Enjoy Your Icon! The icon will now appear: - ✨ Next to your note title in the left sidebar - ✨ In the page header when viewing the note - ✨ In any wiki-links that point to that note --- 📝 Using Icons Inside Your Content You can also use icons directly in your note content! Any time you create a wiki-link to another note, if that note has an icon, it will automatically appear next to the link. Example: If "Dragon Lore" has in its frontmatter, the dragon icon will appear automatically next to the link! No extra work needed. --- 🔍 Where to Find Icons You have access to over 200,000 icons from 150+ icon libraries! Here are the best places to browse: 🎮 Game Icons (Best for D&D/RPG content!) 4,000+ fantasy, medieval, and gaming icons - this is your go-to for RPG content! - Browse all Game Icons: https://game-icons.net/ - Search on Iconify: https://icon-sets.iconify.design/game-icons/ Examples: Dragons, swords, spells, dice, shields, potions, scrolls, monsters ✨ Lucide Icons (Best for simple concepts) Clean, modern icons - great for abstract ideas and UI elements - Browse Lucide: https://lucide.dev/icons/ - Search on Iconify: https://icon-sets.iconify.design/lucide/ Examples: Heart, brain, eye, sparkles, clock, target 🔷 Font Awesome (General purpose) Huge variety - good for common objects and concepts - Browse Font Awesome: https://fontawesome.com/icons - Search on Iconify: https://icon-sets.iconify.design/fa6-solid/ 🔎 Search ALL Icons Not sure which library to use? Search everything at once: Main Search: https://icon-sets.iconify.design/ Just type what you're looking for (like "dragon" or "sword") and browse the results! --- 📝 How to Write Icon Names Icon names have two parts: a prefix (which library) + the icon name. The Magic Formula PascalCase means: CapitalizeTheFirstLetterOfEachWord Common Prefixes (What You'll Use Most) | Prefix | Library | Use For | |--------|---------|---------| | | Game Icons | ⭐ RPG/D&D stuff (use this most!) | | | Lucide | Simple concepts (heart, brain, eye) | | | Font Awesome | General items | | | Heroicons | Modern UI icons | There are 20+ more libraries available - but these four cover 95% of what you'll need! 🎯 Converting Icon Names (The Easy Way) When you find an icon on a website, the name usually has hyphens (like ). Here's how to convert it: Step 1: Look at which library it's from - Game Icons → Use - Lucide → Use - Font Awesome → Use Step 2: Convert the icon name to PascalCase - Remove all hyphens and spaces - Capitalize the first letter of each word Examples: | Website Shows | You Write | |---------------|-----------| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 💡 Pro Tip: The System is Smart! Don't worry too much about getting the prefix exactly right - the system automatically tries multiple icon libraries if it can't find your icon in the first one. So if you write but that icon doesn't exist in Ionicons, it'll automatically try Game Icons, Lucide, Font Awesome, and others until it finds a match! Just focus on getting the icon name close, and the system will help you out. --- 📖 Complete Example Here's a complete note with an icon and wiki-links: What happens: - 🔥 The fireball icon appears in the sidebar next to "Fireball Spell" - 🔥 The icon shows in the page header when you view this note - 🔥 Any wiki-links to this note will show the icon automatically - If "Evocation", "Fire Damage", and "Spell Casting" have their own icons, those will appear next to their links too! --- ❓ Troubleshooting My Icon Isn't Showing - Help! Most Common Issues: 1. Check your frontmatter format 2. Check your icon name 3. Does the icon actually exist? - Go to https://icon-sets.iconify.design/ - Search for your icon name - If you can't find it, try a different search term or similar icon 4. Did you commit and push your changes? - After adding icons, commit and push to GitHub - GitHub Actions automatically updates the system - Wait a minute for deployment, then refresh your browser (Ctrl + F5) Still Not Working? Try these steps: 1. Make sure you committed and pushed your changes to GitHub 2. Check that GitHub Actions completed successfully (green checkmark) 3. Wait a minute or two for the deployment to finish 4. Do a hard refresh: Ctrl + F5 (Windows) or Cmd + Shift + R (Mac) 5. If still not working, check the browser console for error messages (F12 → Console tab) The system will automatically try different icon libraries if the first one doesn't work, so don't worry too much about getting the prefix perfect! --- 🌟 Icon Cheat Sheet for D&D/RPG Content Copy and paste these directly into your notes! ⚔️ Character Classes 📊 Ability Scores 💥 Damage Types 🎒 Equipment Categories 🎲 Game Mechanics 🐉 Creature Types --- 💡 Quick Tips Finding the Perfect Icon 1. Start with Game Icons - Browse at https://game-icons.net/ 2. Can't find it? Search all libraries at https://icon-sets.iconify.design/ 3. Use descriptive names - is better than 4. Don't stress - The system automatically tries multiple libraries if one doesn't work! Best Practices - Use icons consistently across related notes - Preview your icon before committing - some look different than their name suggests - When in doubt, use a Game Icons () icon - they have the best RPG coverage - Icons should enhance your content, not distract from it --- 🔗 Useful Links - Search ALL Icons: https://icon-sets.iconify.design/ - Game Icons (RPG-focused): https://game-icons.net/ - Lucide Icons (Simple/Modern): https://lucide.dev/icons/ - Font Awesome (General): https://fontawesome.com/icons --- 🎉 You're All Set! You now know everything you need to add beautiful icons to your notes. Remember: 1. Add to your frontmatter 2. Save, commit, and push to GitHub 3. Wait a minute for automatic deployment 4. Refresh the page and enjoy your icons! The system handles everything automatically - no need to bother anyone! ✨ Happy writing! 🎨

entries.title: Index
entries.content: 🍔 Mission Statement Malon's Marvelous Misadventures is a TTRPG where the players take on the roles of capable adventurers in a fantasy world, facing off against the odds themselves as they plow through hordes and chow down on the rewards! It's centered on systems that maximize the ease of content creation and compatibility with what exists in other tactical TTRPGs. The content provided will be enough to run relatively lighthearted fantasy games, and serves as a basis to create more and adapt it to your needs. The game mechanics are a blend of real-world intuition and game-y themes, setting a stage with a healthy amount of suspension of disbelief to allow more creative solutions to problems without worrying too much about adherence to realism.

entries.content: Interactive Calculators This page demonstrates interactive calculators that let you create dynamic formulas with input fields and visualizations directly in markdown files. How to Create a Calculator Use the calculator description: A basic linear equation with two variables. Try adjusting the sliders to see how the output changes! formula: y = 2x + 3z inputs: - x: { label: X Value, default: 5, min: 0, max: 100, step: 1 } - z: { label: Z Value, default: 10, min: 0, max: 50, step: 1 } graph: true graphPoints: 30 calculator description: Calculate total damage with base damage, critical multiplier, and bonus damage. formula: totalDamage = baseDamage * critMultiplier + bonusDamage inputs: - baseDamage: { label: Base Damage, default: 20, min: 1, max: 100, step: 1 } - critMultiplier: { label: Critical Multiplier, default: 2, min: 1, max: 5, step: 0.1 } - bonusDamage: { label: Bonus Damage, default: 5, min: 0, max: 50, step: 1 } graph: true graphPoints: 25 calculator description: Experience required for a given level using the formula XP = 100 * level^2 formula: xp = 100 * pow(level, 2) inputs: - level: { label: Character Level, default: 5, min: 1, max: 20, step: 1 } graph: true graphPoints: 20 calculator description: Calculates the percentage chance to hit. Formula assumes d20 roll (5% increments). formula: hitChance = max(5, min(95, (21 - (targetAC - attackBonus)) * 5)) inputs: - attackBonus: { label: Attack Bonus, default: 5, min: 0, max: 20, step: 1 } - targetAC: { label: Target AC, default: 15, min: 10, max: 25, step: 1 } graph: true graphPoints: 20 calculator description: Total health recovered over time with regeneration rate formula: totalHealing = regenRate * rounds + baseHealing inputs: - regenRate: { label: Regen per Round, default: 5, min: 1, max: 20, step: 1 } - rounds: { label: Number of Rounds, default: 5, min: 1, max: 10, step: 1 } - baseHealing: { label: Initial Healing, default: 10, min: 0, max: 50, step: 5 } graph: true graphPoints: 10 calculator description: Calculate circular area using the formula Area = π * radius² formula: area = 3.14159 * pow(radius, 2) inputs: - radius: { label: Radius (feet), default: 10, min: 5, max: 50, step: 5 } graph: true graphPoints: 20 calculator description: Calculate movement speed with base speed, bonus multiplier, and flat bonuses formula: totalSpeed = (baseSpeed * speedMultiplier) + flatBonus inputs: - baseSpeed: { label: Base Speed, default: 30, min: 10, max: 50, step: 5 } - speedMultiplier: { label: Speed Multiplier, default: 1, min: 0.5, max: 2, step: 0.1 } - flatBonus: { label: Flat Bonus, default: 0, min: 0, max: 20, step: 5 } graph: true graphPoints: 25 calculator description: A simple addition calculator without graph visualization formula: sum = a + b + c inputs: - a: { label: First Number, default: 10, min: 0, max: 100, step: 1 } - b: { label: Second Number, default: 20, min: 0, max: 100, step: 1 } - c: { label: Third Number, default: 30, min: 0, max: 100, step: 1 } graph: false ``+-*/pow(base, exponent)sqrt(x)abs(x)min(a, b)max(a, b)round(x)floor(x)ceil(x)sin(x)cos(x)tan(x)` - Trigonometric functions (input in radians)
